page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: {A recent Shropshire population}survey identified 2568 houses in Whitchurch occupied by 6913 people.47% of house holds live in owner occupied houses,34 % in public rented and 18% in private rented{.Redevelopment schemes in 1950's and 60's led to the demolition of the majority of unfit houses in Whitchurch.The council's present emphasis is on improving older sub- standard properties.840 council prop- erties are available for letting and include 35 bungalows,689 houses and 116 flats.{With the increasing number of elderly people,the council has sta- rted to build sheltered accommodation. {Private house construction}has contin- ued steadily.In 1979 there were five large estates with planning permission for 205 houses.It is estimated that land will be needed for a further 500
